titleStmt.title: Flora's departure: or, Summers pride abated. Cold Winter with his icy looks bids Flora to be gone, and bath no more in silver brooks, for Frost is coming on. The tune is, Young Phaeon: or, Busie fame.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the sign of the Angel in Guiltspur-Street, without Newgate.,

notesStmt.note: Date and place of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "Dame Flora in her rich array,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
